DataElement.preferredName: Adrenocortical Carcinoma ENSAT Clinical Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the adrenocortical carcinoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adrenal Cortex Carcinoma Clinical ENSAT M Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A rare, usually large (greater than 5cm), malignant epithelial tumor arising from the adrenal cortical cells.  Symptoms are usually related to the excessive production of hormones, and include Cushing's syndrome and virilism in women.  Common sites of metastasis include liver, lung, bone, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.  Advanced radiologic procedures have enabled the detection of small tumors, resulting in the improvement of the 5-year survival._A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A rare, usually large (greater than 5cm), malignant epithelial tumor arising from the adrenal cortical cells.  Symptoms are usually related to the excessive production of hormones, and include Cushing's syndrome and virilism in women.  Common sites of metastasis include liver, lung, bone, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.  Advanced radiologic procedures have enabled the detection of small tumors, resulting in the improvement of the 5-year survival.

Concepts.definition: A rare, usually large (greater than 5cm), malignant epithelial tumor arising from the adrenal cortical cells.  Symptoms are usually related to the excessive production of hormones, and include Cushing's syndrome and virilism in women.  Common sites of metastasis include liver, lung, bone, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.  Advanced radiologic procedures have enabled the detection of small tumors, resulting in the improvement of the 5-year survival.

Property.preferredName: Clinical ENSAT Staging Finding v7 M Stage
Property.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Clinical Distant Metastasis ENSAT M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Adrenal cancer with no involvement of distant organs or tissues. (7th Ed, 2009)

Concepts.definition: Adrenal cancer with no involvement of distant organs or tissues. (7th Ed, 2009)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Adrenal cancer with involvement of distant organs or tissues such as liver, bone or brain. (7th Ed, 2009)

Concepts.definition: Adrenal cancer with involvement of distant organs or tissues such as liver, bone or brain. (7th Ed, 2009)
